Issues.Title: Suppress CodeQL for BinaryFormatter deserialization in several files
Issues.Body:
Fixes #11804

## Proposed changes

- Suppresses CodeQL for BinaryFormatter deserialization for several files
- Wasn't able to suppress CodeQl for 2 files, due to the following reasons:
  - `src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Resources/ResXSerializationBinder.cs`, line 69: No reference to `BinaryFormatter` in the whole file (except in a comment)
  - `src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/OLE/DataObject.ComposedDataObject.NativeDataObjectToWinFormsAdapter.cs`, line 208: The file could not be found

## Customer Impact

- None

## Regression?

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

## Test environment(s)

- 9.0.100-preview.5.24307.3
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11805)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Suppress CodeQL for BinaryFormatter deserialization in several files" (#11805)

Issues.Title: Suppresses CodeQL for BinaryFormatter deserialization for several files
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.100-preview.5.24307.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

Suppresses CodeQL for BinaryFormatter deserialization for several files:

| File : Line                                                                                                                                            | Rule ID   |
| :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :-------- |
| src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/ComponentModel/Design/Serialization/CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.cs : 228 | [SM03722] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/ComponentModel/Design/Serialization/CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.cs : 228 | [SM04191] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/CommandSet.cs : 1868                                                                   | [SM03722] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/CommandSet.cs : 1868                                                                   | [SM04191] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/OleDragDropHandler.ComponentDataObject.cs : 142                                        | [SM03722] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/OleDragDropHandler.ComponentDataObject.cs : 142                                        | [SM04191] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/OleDragDropHandler.ComponentDataObject.cs : 214                                        | [SM03722] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/OleDragDropHandler.ComponentDataObject.cs : 214                                        | [SM04191] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Resources/ResXDataNode.cs : 449                                                                                    | [SM03722] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Resources/ResXSerializationBinder.cs : 69                                                                          | [SM04225] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ActiveX/AxHost.PropertyBagStream.cs : 44                                                             | [SM03722] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ActiveX/AxHost.PropertyBagStream.cs : 44                                                             | [SM04191] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ActiveX/Control.ActiveXImpl.cs : 1158                                                                | [SM03722] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ActiveX/Control.ActiveXImpl.cs : 1158                                                                | [SM04191] |
| src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/OLE/DataObject.ComposedDataObject.NativeDataObjectToWinFormsAdapter.cs : 208                         | [SM03722] |

### Steps to reproduce

None
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Suppresses CodeQL for BinaryFormatter deserialization for several files" (#11804)

Issues.Title: Update Analyzer docs and number groups.
Issues.Body:
* Adds a series of md files, which contain the docs for upcoming analyzers.
* Adds a text file with the aka.ms-->md-URL target list.
* Organizes all Analyzer doc relevant file in a dedicated folder.

Needed before we merge the experimental features for .NET 9.

Issues.Title: Unstable unit test: TreeNode_TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTipTests.TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTip_InvokeIsHoveredWithMouse_ReturnsExpected
Issues.Body:
Related https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/11227

### Test

System.Windows.Forms.Tests.TreeNode_TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTipTests.TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTip_InvokeIsHoveredWithMouse_ReturnsExpected(insideTreeView: True, isHovered: True, expected: True)

### Issue description

The case failed in [dotnet-winforms CI](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng-public/public/_build?definitionId=76&_a=summary), the failed scenario:

- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.TreeNode_TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTipTests.TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTip_InvokeIsHoveredWithMouse_ReturnsExpected(insideTreeView: True, isHovered: True, expected: True)


**Error Message:**

- **In X64 unit:**
     - Assert.Equal() Failure: Values differ
       Expected: True
       Actual:   False


**Stack trace:**
```
   at System.Windows.Forms.Tests.TreeNode_TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTipTests.TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTip_InvokeIsHoveredWithMouse_ReturnsExpected(Boolean insideTreeView, Boolean isHovered, Boolean expected) in D:\a\_work\1\s\src\System.Windows.Forms\tests\UnitTests\System\Windows\Forms\TreeNode.IKeyboardToolTipTests.cs:line 381
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Void** arguments, Signature sig, Boolean isConstructor)
   at System.Reflection.MethodBaseInvoker.InvokeDirectByRefWithFewArgs(Object obj, Span`1 copyOfArgs, BindingFlags invokeAttr)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unstable unit test: TreeNode_TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTipTests.TreeNodeIKeyboardToolTip_InvokeIsHoveredWithMouse_ReturnsExpected" (#11797)

Issues.Title: Unstable unit test: BindingContextTests.BindingContext_Item_GetIListSourceDataSourceWithDataMemberReturningIListNull_ThrowsArgumentNullException
Issues.Body:
Related #11227

### Test

System.Windows.Forms.Tests.BindingContextTests.BindingContext_Item_GetIListSourceDataSourceWithDataMemberReturningIListNull_ThrowsArgumentNullException

### Issue description

The case failed in [dotnet-winforms CI](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng-public/public/_build?definitionId=76&_a=summary)

**Error Message:**

- **In X86 unit:**
     - Assert.IsType() Failure: Value is null
       Expected: typeof(System.Windows.Forms.PropertyManager)
       Actual:   null


**Stack trace:**
```
   at System.Windows.Forms.Tests.BindingContextTests.BindingContext_Item_GetIListSourceDataSourceWithDataMemberReturningIListNull_ThrowsArgumentNullException() in /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/UnitTests/System/Windows/Forms/BindingContextTests.cs:line 682
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Void** arguments, Signature sig, Boolean isConstructor)
   at System.Reflection.MethodBaseInvoker.InterpretedInvoke_Method(Object obj, IntPtr* args)
   at System.Reflection.MethodBaseInvoker.InvokeWithNoArgs(Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unstable unit test: BindingContextTests.BindingContext_Item_GetIListSourceDataSourceWithDataMemberReturningIListNull_ThrowsArgumentNullException" (#11795)

Issues.Title: The ToolStripMenuItem cannot be deleted successfully using Delete key
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

feature/10.0 branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this issue also repro in .NET 9.0 main branch of WinForms repo branch of WinForms repo.

### Issue description

**More info:**
1. This issue cannot repro when using Delete key to delete other control, and then delete ToolStripMenuItem.
2. This issue cannot repro when using Delete in Edit menu.

**Actual result in [[DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole)] test app:**
The ToolStripMenuItem cannot be deleted successfully using Delete key.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/efe0612c-ad63-43e9-898c-001ddc9a2c2e


**Expected result:**
The ToolStripMenuItem can be deleted successfully using Delete key.


### Steps to reproduce


Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) bases on feature/10.0 branch in Winforms repo.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The ToolStripMenuItem cannot be deleted successfully using Delete key" (#11794)

Issues.Title: The SplitContainer control cannot be deleted successfully under ToolStripContainer tab
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

feature/10.0 branch of Winforms repo

Not tested/verified

No, this was changed after the PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11678

**Expected result:**
The SplitContainer control can be deleted successfully under ToolStripContainer tab 

### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) bases on feature/10.0 branch in Winforms repo.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The SplitContainer control cannot be deleted successfully under ToolStripContainer tab " (#11793)

Issues.Title: The RichTextBox control is not support the SmartTag under ToolStripContainer tab
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

feature/10.0 branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this was changed after the PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11678

### Issue description

**Actual result in [[DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole))] test app:**
The RichTextBox control is not support the SmartTag under ToolStripContainer tab
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffa669d9-f81e-4156-886b-487b8067fd44)

**Expected result:**
The RichTextBox control should support the SmartTag under ToolStripContainer tab
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0d48a276-6568-4d4c-b4cb-73dec5c0d97e)

### Steps to reproduce
Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) bases on feature/10.0 branch in Winforms repo

**More info:**
The SplitContainer control also support the SmartTag under ToolStripContainer tab
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1f0ec52e-56d8-456a-b439-250aa4ac5b49)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The RichTextBox control is not support the SmartTag under ToolStripContainer tab" (#11792)

Issues.Title: The DemoConsole app under the Winforms repo will stop running when delete the RichTextBox control under ToolStripContainer tab
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

feature/10.0 branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this was changed after the PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11678

### Issue description

**Actual result in [[DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole))]** test app:
The DemoConsole app under the Winforms repo will stop running when delete the RichTextBox control under ToolStripContainer tab with **Debug** mode
![GHIssue1](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ebb85c0b-5beb-4696-8eb5-f7151383526d)

**Debug Call Stack:**
![Exceptions](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e4306a14-66f4-438c-9120-234b34d2d838)

**Expected result:**
The DemoConsole app under the Winforms repo running well when delete the RichTextBox control under ToolStripContainer tab

### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) bases on feature/10.0 branch in Winforms repo on **Debug** mode.

**More info:**
The issue cannot reproduce on **release** mode
![ReleaseMode](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f1e5643-a3a2-47c8-867b-0cabf35f6ec1)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The DemoConsole app under the Winforms repo will stop running when delete the RichTextBox control under ToolStripContainer tab" (#11790)

Issues.Title: The selected control have no border line in the DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

feature/10.0 branch of Winforms repo 

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this was changed after the PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11678

### Issue description



**Actual result in [[DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole)]** test app:
The selected control have no border line in the DemoConsole application, 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f09edba7-2746-4d4c-99bb-60ff2ff1e12e)

**Expected result:**
The selected control should have a solid border or border line in the DemoConsole application, like this issue https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/11353
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aba6486c-0e6a-41f2-a0d8-41a17b2726bb)






### Steps to reproduce
Test sample:  [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole)  bases on feature/10.0 branch in Winforms repo.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The selected control have no border line in the DemoConsole application" (#11789)

Issues.Title: Put back AddStatement call in CodeDomSerializer
Issues.Body:
Overlooked in the code review when removing the tracing.

I've done a full review twice. Two other small tweaks to WriteResource to remove the TraceScope name.

Fixes #11657
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11788)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Put back AddStatement call in CodeDomSerializer" (#11788)

Issues.Title: Handle null PropertyDescriptor in PropertyGrid value set event
Issues.Body:
It is possible to not have a PropertyDescriptor, we should handle that case.

Fixes #11768
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11787)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Handle null PropertyDescriptor in PropertyGrid value set event" (#11787)

Issues.Title: Defer GDI+ initialization to first PInvoke access
Issues.Body:
Initializing GDI+ on module load left GDI+ with a stale DPI setting. It has to come after the call to Application.SetHighDpiMode.

Fixes #11608

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11781)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Defer GDI+ initialization to first PInvoke access" (#11781)

Issues.Title: Errors while compiling WinformsControlsTest app in winforms repo
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

Latest Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, build WinformsControlsTest can works well on Monday(7/29) in winforms repo.

### Issue description

Clone winforms repo then use **start-vs.cmd** to open it in VS, right-click on WinformsControlsTest and select **Build**.

Actual result:
43 errors display in Error List window.
![BuildErrors](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d4f8bb3-85f6-4455-8369-105926934a36)

Expected result:
Build WinformsControlsTest app successfully with no error.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Clone winforms repo: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms.git
2. In repo folder, run start-vs.cmd to open it in VS
3. Switch to feature/10.0 branch
4. In Solution Explorer, right-click on WinformsControlsTest and select **Build**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Errors while compiling WinformsControlsTest app in winforms repo" (#11783)

Issues.Title: Fixes duplicate component name 'BindingNavigatorSeparator' and adds BindingNavigatorDesigner to DemoConsole
Issues.Body:
Related #11669

## Proposed changes

- Addresses [error](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/11669#issuecomment-2257902574) `ArgumentException: Duplicate component name 'BindingNavigatorSeparator'. Component names must be unique and case-insensitive.` by assigning different names to the binding separators in the `BindingNavigator` control
- Adds `BindingNavigatorDesigner` instance to the `DemoConsole` app

## Customer Impact

- None

## Regression?

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

## Screenshots

### Before
![before](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cf063f35-ce25-404f-ada4-ed9b19c59db7)

### After
![after](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d267aa4-93ea-4f92-81ca-ff58a7a6acdb)

## Test methodology

- Manual

## Test environment(s)

- 9.0.100-preview.5.24307.3

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11780)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fixes duplicate component name 'BindingNavigatorSeparator' and adds BindingNavigatorDesigner to DemoConsole" (#11780)
